docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
I only tested the installation using pipx :

# Windows users might need to specify the full python.exe path
python.exe -m pip install pipx
python.exe -m pipx install "cyberclip @ git+https://github.com/BongoKnight/cyberclip"

You might need to use python.exe -m pipx ensurepath in order to add the binary to your PATH.

  • Create the .env file in cyberclip installation path
  • Add customs parser/actions in the private directory under cyberclip/userAction and cyberclip/userTypeParser, some example will be added in the "Getting started" tutoriel and in the graveyard directory.

If installed with pipx, the installation path should be something like C:\Users\<user>\pipx\venvs\cyberclip\Lib\site-packages\cyberclip (Windows) or /home/<user>/.local/share/pipx/venvs/cyberclip/lib/python3.13/site-packages/cyberclip/ (Linux)

Then you should be able to run the script with :

# On linux
cyberclip
# On Windows
cyberclip.exe
# Or alternatively with :
cd "C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\site-packages\cyberclip" && python3 app.py

docs.title: Requests and improvments
docs.text:
• Feel free to open an issue if you think of other type of data to parse, or if you think of an action you would like to be applied to a specific type of data,
  • Feel free to open an issue if you have some crash, I think I need to improve the error handling to avoid the crashing of the GUI

docs.title: Goal
docs.text:
This tutorial explain in depth the process to create a new action. We will create a new action for dowloading a video accessible through an URL.

You might need to install youtube-dl with this command :

# Install last version according to :
# https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/issues/31530#issuecomment-1435477247

pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall "git+https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl.git"

docs.title: Creating the action Class
docs.text:
• Create a new file called downloadAction.py in the userAction/private/ directory of your cyberclip installation.
  • Paste this content inside it :
# Import the actionInterface which give common behaviour to all actions
try:
    from userAction.actionInterface import actionInterface
except:
    from actionInterface import actionInterface
import youtube_dl

class downloadVideoAction(actionInterface):
    """A action module, to download video from an URL.
Use of the youtube-dl.
    """
    def __init__(self, parsers = {}, supportedType = {"url"}):
        super().__init__(parsers = parsers, supportedType = supportedType)
        self.description = "Download video from URL"

At this time, your new action should already appears in the interface when you search for it in the command palette (Ctrl+P) :

A few things to keep in mind in order to make your action work :

  • While importing action, only classes which contains Action in their name are imported as action,
  • The supportedType will indicate in which case your action should be loaded. If you want your action to be always displayed in the terminal user interface (TUI), you might want to indicated your action supports text parser,
  • The self.description value is used by the TUI and is displayed inside the button that triggers the action,
  • The docstring is displayed inside the TUI command pallette and as a tooltip while hoovering the action button.

docs.title: Adding the logic behind the action
docs.text:
Now in order to bring some usefullness to your action, you might want to define what your action do. Here your action should take a link in input and download video from the link. You have to define this behaviour inside the execute method.

    def execute(self) -> object:
        self.get_observables()
        self.results = {}
        ydl_opts = {
            'outtmpl': '~/Downloads/%(extractor_key)s/%(extractor)s-%(id)s-%(title)s.%(ext)s',
        }
        for url in self.observables.get("url", []):
            try:
                with youtube_dl.YoutubeDL(ydl_opts) as ydl:
                    ydl.download([url])
                    self.results.update({url:"Downloaded."})
            except Exception as e:
                self.results.update({url:f"Error while downloading : {str(e)}"})
        return self.results

    def __str__(self):
        return str(self.execute())
  • A best practice is to make the execute method returning a dict in form of {"parsed-value":"result of action"}, this make the action compatible with the table view.
  • The __str__ method is here to deliver a human readable return on the action, this method is called to display the action result inside the TextArea widget in the TUI. __str__ should call the self.execute method.

docs.title: Extract data
docs.text: At the moment, these datatypes are handled : - Text - Url - Domain - TSV - md5 and SHA1 - IP - Autonomous system number - Mail - HTML - Yara - JSON - Mitre TTP and Phones (need to be improved)

docs.title: Filter actions by name and type
Save data
docs.text: Showed data can be exported to clipboard or to a file.

docs.title: ClipBrowser(driver_class=None, css_path=None, watch_css=False)
docs.text:
Bases: App

This class implements the App class from textual. It defines the layout of the Terminal User Interface (TUI).

Attributes:

Name Type Description text str

Store the text available in all the application, this text is usually updated with data contained in the clipboard.

parser clipParser

A text parser that parse text to extract valuable data (thanks to userTypeParser) and execute action based on the data extracted (thanks to userAction).

active_tab str

Name of the currently active tab

docs.title: compose()
docs.text:
Compose the main UI. Generate three tabs corresponding to the three modes of the application :

  • Main view which displays the content of keyboard, parser extractors on left and actions on right.
  • Table view for sorting and filtering results of action or to enrich tabular data/files.
  • Rules view for managing rules to apply to data (chains of actions with defined parameters), the rules became new actions available in the command pallette.
Warning

Table and rule views are a WIP.

docs.title: clean_tsv(new_text, text)
docs.text:
If new_text is a TSV value that starts with text as a first field, returns everythings except this field

Code exemple :: clean_tsv("a baba", "a")

"baba" clean_tsv("b baba", "a") "b baba"

docs.title: CVEExplainerAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'cve'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Get information associated to a CVE number.

Information are retrieved from https://cveawg.mitre.org/api/cve/.

Example:

cve-2024-3400 returns cve-2024-3400 10 CRITICAL PAN-OS,Cloud NGFW,Prisma Access 2024-04-12T07:20:00.707Z A command injection as a result of arbitrary file creation vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall.Cloud NGFW, Panorama appliances, and Prisma Access are not impacted by this vulnerability. https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-3400,https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cve-2024-3400/,https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/04/12/zero-day-exploitation-of-unauthenticated-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-globalprotect-cve-2024-3400/,https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/blog/2024/04/more-on-the-pan-os-cve/

docs.title: JSONExtractAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'json', 'yaml'}, complex_param=CONF)
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Extract data from a JSON or YAML object using jq. You can test your queries here: https://jqplay.org/

Example::

{"a":"elem1","b":"elem2","c":3, "d":[{"a":"elem3","b":"elem4","c":5},{"a":"elem5","b":"elem6","c":2}]}

With the JSON above:

  • .a selector will return "elem1"
  • .c selector will return 3
  • .d[].a selector will return "elem3" "elem5"
  • .d[] | select(.c>2) selector will return {"a": "elem3","b": "elem4","c": 5}

docs.title: JSONFlattenAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'json', 'yaml'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

A action module to flatten data from a JSON object.

docs.title: JSONSchemeAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'json', 'yaml'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Display the scheme of a JSON object.

Example::

{"a":"elem1","b":"elem2","c":3, "d":[{"a":"elem3","b":"elem4","c":5},{"a":"elem5","b":"elem6","c":2}]}

With the JSON above returns:

a
b
c
d
d[]
d[].a
d[].b
d[].c

docs.title: actionInterface(**kwargs)
docs.text:
Action Interface defines the minimum functions a parser needs to implement.

  • execute : The logic part of the action, this method define what the action does.
  • __str__ : Visual representation of the action after being executed.

Attributes:

Name Type Description parsers dict of str

ParserInterface): A dict of parsers interface, these are used to extract observales from text

observables list of str

A list of observables extracted by the parsers

conf dict

A configuration extracted from conf.yaml, this store data needed for the action to be executed (API Key for example)

supportedType list of str

A list of type defined in the varaible parsertype that are supported by the current action.

results list of object

Storing the result of the action execution

Note

While overwriting execute method in a class which inherits from ActionInterface, you should modify the results attributes in order to return a dictionnary where keys are the parsed observable and values are the results of the action.

parsers (dict of str:ParserInterface): A dict of parsers interface, these are used to 
extract observales from text
conf (dict): A configuration extracted from `conf.yaml`, this store data needed 
    for the action to be executed (API Key for example) 
supportedType (list of str):  A list of type defined in the varaible `parsertype` 
    that are supported by the current action.        
description (str): A short description/name of the action
indicators (str): used to describe some action limitation (i.e. requires API-Key, external files, is slow...)

docs.title: __str__()
docs.text:
Return a textual representation of the action results. By default returns the str representation of self.results. However you could make some pretty printing here, such as Markdown, TSV or any other string representation that fulfill your needs.

Note

This textual representation is displayed in the Terminal User Interface (TUI) when you execute the action. This method is used to provides feedback.

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Execute the action

Returns:

Name Type Description results dict

Returns a dictionary consisting of the observables parsed in text and the results of the action for each one of it.

Note

Values of the returned dict could be wathever you need. The key of the dict are used to make join between dataset in the table view of the TUI.

docs.title: get_observables()
docs.text:
Returns:

Type Description dict[str, dict]

self.observables (dict): Populate the self.observables by a dictionnary with the following structure : {<Parser_type>:[<list of observables of this type>]} Reset the self.results variables.

Info

This method is implemented to simplify the writting of new action. If you want to differientiate how an action handle different type of observables (ie IP addresses and domain), you might use something like this in your execute method : 

self.observables = self.get_observables()
for ip in self.observables.get("ip", []):
    <behaviour regarding IP address>
for ip in self.observables.get("domain", []):
    <behaviour regarding Domain Name>

For example :

Return permutation encode of a string in base 64. Allowing to create YARA rule or search Malware or Phishing sample using specific functions.

For example :

  • document.location returns Y3VtZW50LmxvY2F0,b2N1bWVudC5sb2Nh,dW1lbnQubG9jYXRp

docs.title: crtshCertificatesAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'domain'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Recover list of certificate for a domain using crt.sh. Should only be used on small domain list.

Certificates fields that are returned are:

issuer_ca_id: int
issuer_name: str
common_name: str
name_value: str
id: int
entry_timestamp: str
not_before: str
not_after: str
serial_number: str
result_count: int

docs.title: searchInVirusTotalAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'ip', 'domain', 'md5', 'sha1', 'sha256'}, complex_param=DEFAULT_PARAMS)
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Search ip, domain, MD5, SHA1 and SHA256 with the Virus Total API. Results are returned in JSON format. The configuration should be passed in the config file.

A parameter could be passed :

- `Relationships` a list of relationships to query, be carreful each additionnal relationship consume an API credit. For each observable results will be added under `$.data.<relationship_name>` key and thus specific fields of relationship could be retrievedwith `$.relationships.relationship_name.<path>` thanks to the `Analysis fields` parameter

A configuration is neeeded : 

VirusTotal:
- api_key: <VT API Key>

docs.title: searchInShodanAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'ip'}, complex_param={'IP Analysis fields': {'type': 'tags', 'value': ['$.ports', '$.domains', '$.data[:].http.server', '$.data[:].http.html_hash', '$.data[:].http.title', '$.data[:].http.port', '$.data[:].http.headers_hash']}, 'Allow bulk search': {'type': 'boolean', 'value': False}, 'Free account': {'type': 'boolean', 'value': False}})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Search all type of observables with the Shodan API. The API Key is passed in the config file. Only IP are handled atm. No bulk search on basic plan, wait 1s between each querry.

A configuration is neeeded : 

Shodan:
- api-key: <API Key>

docs.title: countAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Count the number of time each unique line is contained in a text.

Return

docs.title: execute()
docs.text: Count the number of occurence of each line.

docs.title: extractRegexGroupAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={'Regex': {'type': 'text', 'value': ''}})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Extract group matching a regex. Enter the regex as a param.

docs.title: findReplaceAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={'Search': '', 'Replace': ''})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Search and replace using regex.sub(). Enter the regex as a param.

docs.title: execute()
docs.text: Find a regex pattern and replace it.

docs.title: fromHexAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Convert a hexadecimal string to the corresponding UTF-8 string. String should not be prefixed by 0x

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Convert a hexadecimal string to the corresponding UTF-8 string. String should not be prefixed by 0x.

Returns:

Type Description object

bytes.fromhex(text).decode('utf-8')

docs.title: prependAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={'Text to add': {'type': 'text', 'value': ''}})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Prepend text to a given text.

Usefull for adding a header to data.

docs.title: __str__()
docs.text: Add a line of text at the beginning of a text.

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Add a line of text at the beginning of a text.

Return

text (str): Text with prepended data

docs.title: prependEachLineAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={'Text to prepend': {'type': 'text', 'value': ''}})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Add text at the beginning of each line of a given text. Enter the text to preprend as a param.

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Add a line of text at the end of each line of a text.

Return

text (str): Text with prepended data

docs.title: regexFilterAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={'Regex': {'type': 'text', 'value': ''}})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Filter lines matching a regex. Enter the regex as a param.

docs.title: reverseRegexFilterAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={'Regex': {'type': 'text', 'value': ''}})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Filter lines not matching a regex. Enter the regex as a param.

docs.title: saveInFileAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={'Save as': {'type': 'save', 'value': './tmp.txt'}})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Save the actual data in a file

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Save text in a file.

Returns:

Type Description object

lines[0:n] (list(str)): The n first lines

docs.title: timestampToDateAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Convert a Unix timestamp to a readable date

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Convert a text which is a timestamp to a date.

Returns:

Type Description object

datetime.datetime(timestamp)

docs.title: toHexAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Convert a UTF-8 string to the coressponding one in hexadecimal.

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Convert a UTF-8 string to the coressponding one in hexadecimal.

Returns:

Type Description object

text.encode().hex()

docs.title: toLowerCaseAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Return the given text in lower case.

Hello returns hello

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Add a line of text at the end of each line of a text.

Return

text (str): Text lower cased

docs.title: toUperCaseAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Return the given text in UPPER case.

Hello returns HELLO

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Add a line of text at the end of each line of a text.

Return

text (str): Text upper cased

docs.title: toplLinesAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param={'Number of lines': {'type': 'text', 'value': '10'}})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

A action module to crop data to only the N first lines. Default 10 lines.

docs.title: execute()
docs.text:
Return the N first lines of a text.

Returns:

Type Description object

lines[0:n] (list(str)): The n first lines

docs.title: toMarkdownAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'tsv'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Transform a TSV data to a Markdown table.

docs.title: regexOrAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Transform lines to an OR regex For example if the text contain two lines with : a and b It will return a|b.

docs.title: toSqlSearchAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'})
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

A action module, to transform lines to an Python list or an IN SQL querry. For example if the text contain two lines with : a and b It will return "a","b".

docs.title: translateWithDeeplAction(parsers={}, supportedType={'text'}, complex_param=DEFAULT_PARAMS)
docs.text:
Bases: actionInterface

Translate a text through the DeepL API.

A configuration and an API key are neeeded :

Deepl: - api_key:

docs.title: asnumParser(text, parsertype='asnum')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for asnum strings.

Code exemple :: a = asnumParser("dqsdq. fdsf") b = asnumParser("AS2456") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return True if text contains at least one asnum.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text:
Return all asnum contained in text.

Return

asmums (list(str)): A list of as number with the following format : AS or as

docs.title: AnalyticsIdParser(text, parsertype='cve')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for various strings related to analytics. Supports Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics and Hotjar.

Code exemple :: a = AnalyticsIdParser("dsfsd sdfsdf sdfsdhj j") b = AnalyticsIdParser("G-XXXXXXX") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one analytics id.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all analytics id contained in text.

docs.title: B64Parser(text, parsertype='b64')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for Base64 strings.

Code exemple :: a = asnumParser("dqsdq. fdsf") b = asnumParser("dG90bw==") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return True if text contains at least one base 64 line.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text:
Return all base64 lines contained in text.

Return

b64 (list(str)): A list of as number with the following format : AS or as

docs.title: CVEParser(text, parsertype='cve')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for CVE strings.

Code exemple :: a = CVEParser("dsfsd sdfsdf sdfsdhj j") b = CVEParser("CVE-2024-22252") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one CVE.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all CVE contained in text.

docs.title: HtmlParser(text, parsertype='html')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for HTML strings.

Code exemple :: a = HtmlParser("dsfsd sdfsdf sdfsdhj j") b = HtmlParser("Hello, world") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

Source : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/24856035/how-to-detect-with-python-if-the-string-contains-html-code

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one Mitre TTP.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return the whole text as object.

docs.title: CIDRParser(text, parsertype='cidr')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Parser for CIDR.

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one CIDR

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all CIDR contained in text.

docs.title: ipv4Parser(text, parsertype='ip')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for ip strings.

Code exemple :: a = ipParser("1212.1.2.3") b = ipParser("1.2.3[.]4") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one ip.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all ip contained in text.

docs.title: ipv6Parser(text, parsertype='ipv6')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Parser for ipv6.

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one ip.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all ip contained in text.

docs.title: ja4Parser(text, parsertype='ja4')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for JA4 hash.

Code exemple :: a = ja4Parser("1.3.4.5") b = ja4Parser("ge11cn020000_9ed1ff1f7b03_cd8dafe26982") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one JA4.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all JA4 contained in text.

docs.title: JSONParser(text, parsertype='json')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for JSON strings. Use json.loads

Code exemple :: a = JsonParser("ccdf ") b = JsonParser("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains JSON valid data

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all JSON contained in text.

docs.title: CombinedLogParser(text, parsertype='cve')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for CombinedLog strings. Cf. https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/fr/logs.html

Code exemple :: a = CombinedLogParser('127.0.0.1 - jg [27/Apr/2012:11:27:36 +0700] "GET /regexcookbook.html HTTP/1.1" 200 2326') b = CombinedLogParser("CVE-2024-22252") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one combined log formated line

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all Combined logs contained in text.

docs.title: CommonLogParser(text, parsertype='cve')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for CommonLog strings. Cf. https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/fr/logs.html

Code exemple :: a = CommonLogParser('127.0.0.1 - jg [27/Apr/2012:11:27:36 +0700] "GET /regexcookbook.html HTTP/1.1" 200 2326') b = CommonLogParser("CVE-2024-22252") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one CommonLog formated line

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all common log contained in text.

docs.title: md5Parser(text, parsertype='md5')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for md5 strings.

Code exemple :: a = md5Parser("1.3.4.5") b = md5Parser("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one md5.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all md5 contained in text.

docs.title: MitreParser(text, parsertype='mitre')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for URL strings.

Code exemple :: a = URLParser("dsfsd sdfsdf sdfsdhj j") b = URLParser("http://youpi.google.com/test.php?q=3Rte") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one Mitre TTP.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all TTP contained in text.

docs.title: ParserInterface(text, parsertype='interface')
docs.text: Parser Interface defines the minimum functions a parser needs to implement.

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Have to return true if input text contains the parsed type.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Extract a list of objects of parsed type.

docs.title: phoneParser(text, parsertype='phone')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for phone strings.

Code exemple :: a = phoneParser("dqdsdqsd") b = phoneParser("70011223344") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one phone.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all phone contained in text.

docs.title: RFCParser(text, parsertype='rfc')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface to detect mention of RFC (Request for comment).

Code exemple :: a = RFCParser("dsfsd sdfsdf sdfsdhj j") b = RFCParser("RFC 2646") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one RFC.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all RFC contained in text.

docs.title: tsvParser(text, parsertype='tsv')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for tsv strings.

Code exemple :: a = tsvParser("ccdf ") b = tsvParser("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains TSV data in at least two columns.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all tsv contained in text.

docs.title: TextParser(text, parsertype='text')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for text. If the text is not the blank string return True. Allow to make transforms on a text.

Code exemple :: a = TextParser("1.3.4.5") b = TextParser("toto") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text is not blank.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return the whole text as object.

docs.title: URLParser(text, parsertype='url')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for URL strings.

Code exemple :: a = URLParser("dsfsd sdfsdf sdfsdhj j") b = URLParser("http://youpi.google.com/test.php?q=3Rte") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one URL.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all URL contained in text.

docs.title: YamlParser(text, parsertype='yaml')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for Yaml strings. Use yaml.safe_load

Code exemple :: a = YamlParser("ccdf ") b = YamlParser("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains Yaml valid data

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all JSON contained in text.

docs.title: domainParser(text, parsertype='domain')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for domain strings.

Code exemple :: a = domainParser("dqsdq. fdsf") b = domainParser("domain.com") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one domain.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all domain contained in text.

docs.title: filenameParser(text, parsertype='filename')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for FileName strings.

Code exemple :: a = filenameParser("dsfsd sdfsdf sdfsdhj j") b = filenameParser('C:/Users/svernin/AppData/Local/Temp/Sans titre.jpg') print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one filename.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all filenames contained in text and existing in the filesystem.

docs.title: mailParser(text, parsertype='mail')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for mail strings.

Code exemple :: a = mailParser("1.3.4.5") b = mailParser("toto@domain.com") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one mail.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all mail contained in text.

docs.title: SHA1Parser(text, parsertype='sha1')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for SHA1 strings.

Code exemple :: a = SHA1Parser("ccdf ") b = SHA1Parser("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one SHA1.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all SHA1 contained in text.

docs.title: SHA256Parser(text, parsertype='sha256')
docs.text:
Bases: ParserInterface

Implementation of ParserInterface for SHA256 strings.

Code exemple :: a = SHA1Parser("ccdf ") b = SHA1Parser("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa") print(a.extract(), a.contains()) print(b.extract(), b.contains())

docs.title: contains()
docs.text: Return true if text contains at least one SHA1.

docs.title: extract()
docs.text: Return all SHA1 contained in text.
